sentence.Network_en: Bishop Daly said he was devastated by news of the Cardinal's death.
sentence.Network_cn: 戴利主教说他听到红衣主教去世的消息后感到极为震惊和难过。

sentence.Network_en: I've heard a whisper that the Bishop intends to leave.
sentence.Network_cn: 我听到有谣传说主教打算离开.

sentence.Network_en: A new Catholic bishop was installed in Galway yesterday.
sentence.Network_cn: 昨天在戈尔韦任命了一位新的天主教主教。

因为其位阶次于牧首/宗主教，与都主教(Metropolitan bishop)、大主教(Archbishop)相当，因此有不少英中字典译为都主教、大主教。 …
枢机主教（Cardinal Bishop）、宗主教（Patriarch）、首席主教（Primate）、总主教（Archbishop）、都主教（Metropolitan）、教 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  biscop, bisceop, based on Greek episkopos 'overseer', from epi 'above' + -skopos '-looking'

entry.def: A bishop is a clergyman of high rank in the Roman Catholic, Anglican, and Orthodox churches.
In chess a bishop is a piece that can be moved diagonally across the board on squares that are the same colour.

means.word_mean: 1. a clergyman having spiritual and administrative authority; appointed in Christian churches to oversee priests or ministers; considered in some churches to be successors of the twelve apostles of Christ
2. port wine mulled with oranges and cloves
3. (chess) a piece that can be moved diagonally over unoccupied squares of the same color

Sentence.sentence: Bishop describes the problem as simply a matter of priorities, which can be solved by encouraging people to prioritize other life goals and plans in place of time spent online.
Jonathan Bishop believes that the Internet overuse problem can be solved if people try to improve the Internet environment

sentences.en: Each player has two bishops at the start of the game.

jushi.english: He was a bishop who was held in reverence by all.
jushi.chinese: 他是一位被大家尊敬的主教。
